Name: Curious George A B See Game
Description: In Curious George A B See Game, four cards playing cards are set in front of the players.  The cards are double sided and contain either: (1) different colored letters of the alphabet or (2) different colored objects (purple zebra, green triangle, etc.).  A color and letter card are simultaneously flipped over.  The players must quickly find either a letter that is in the correct color or an object in the correct color that begins with the chosen letter.  If you are the first to identify the combination, you get the letter card.  Any player that makes a misidentification loses a card already won.  After all 26 letters have been played, the winner is the player with the most cards.

Name: Old New Testament
Description:
Quiz based card game featuring questions from both the Old and new Testaments.

This game is vol 3 of Ramco's 10 volume set of quiz card games.

Can be combined with other sets for a larger and more diverse game.

Features 52 doubled sized cards containing 3 levels of difficulty (Beginner, Advanced and Master).

Name: Burn Out!
Description:
Experience for yourself those "Happy Days" of roller skatin' drive in's, rock 'n' roll music, burgers - fries - malts, and best of all...impressin' your best gal and your best pals... just you and your souped-up, tricked out, really boss, totally cool, smmmoookkkinnn'...Hot Rod Car.

The legacy of America's Happy Days of Hot Rod muscle cars lives on as you and your friends run race after thrilling race. A time when 400 H.P. and smokin' tires were the "rules of the Street".

Remember to buckle-up and hang on...you're in for the ride of your life.

Name: Stack-A-Derm
Description: "The Stack-A-Derm Game, the Precarious Pachyderm Pile Up" has a hand-crafted wooden elephant with a large disk on his back, 80 wooden chips, and a single die.  Players take turns placing the wooden chips (number determined by a die roll) on the elephant's back, with each chip not touching the one previously placed.  Any chips that fall are given to the player.  When all chips have been used, the player with the least chips wins.

Name: Flip-Tac-Toe
Description:
Stack, slide, and flip your way to 3 in a row!

Players will flip for this strategic twist on traditional tic-tac-toe. The goal remains to get three of your color chips in a row...but now players can stack pieces, move them around, or even flip the stacks over. Just when you think you've got your chips lined up, the game takes a surprising turn! Includes game board, 64 big foam color chips, and guide. Grades 1 and up.

Name: TetraTrax
Description:
Drop in and win!

"Shape up" strategic thinking skills with TetraTrax. Players slip their puzzle tiles down the rails into the clear tower, and score 1 point for every opposing tile their puzzle tile touches. Watch out, though...you'll lose a point if you leave open spaces in the puzzle. The tension builds as the height of the puzzle grows. Includes game tower with built-in score keeper, 24 game tiles in two colors, and guide. For 2 players. 
Grades 1 and up.

Name: Wrestling Madness
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Wrestling Madness is a wrestling board game for 2-6 players; ages 8 to adult.  In an arena where only the toughest survive and the heroes are made of steel, watching is the next best thing to being in the ring.  Until now!  If you think you have what it takes to join the ranks of Wrestling's very best, then it is time to join the Madness.  Wrestling Madness.  A wrestling board game where you claw your way through the ranks of the professional wrestling circuit by wrestling tough opponents and earning cash.  Travel the mad Wrestling circuit earning money and wrestling your way to the top of the wrestling world.  You must earn $100,000 before getting the chance to take on the mad Wrestling Federation's Champion.  The first player to defeat this champion is the new mad Wrestling champion of the world and Winner of this exciting wrestling board game.

Name: Equazzle
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Ages 5+.  An educational award winner, Equazzle successfully combines what kids think are total opposites:  Math and Fun!  The 5 to 8-year-old plays Equazzle using the addition and subtraction side of the board, while the reverse side reinforces multiplication skills and introduces negative numbers to the 8+ set.  The playing pieces can be used as a perpetual puzzle for youngsters starting as early as age 3.

Name: Sentence Says Dice Edition
Description:
From the publisher's website:

Sentence Says Dice Edition is hilarious fun for the entire family to play at home or on the road!  Draw an action card and read the sentence instruction.  Now roll the letter dice to see what letters you will get to create your sentence.  Hurry, the timer's running out!  What will your sentence say?  For the letters: F, L, S, I and P, how about "Frogs Like Singing In Ponds-" Opponents judge a winning sentence and can steal it if you're not careful!  Educational benefits include:  sentence structure, critical thinking, oral communication and quick-thinking exercises.  For 2-4 players.

Name: Split
Description: Each of the two players chooses a color from among those on the perimeter of the board shown, and each places one of his tokens (such as black and white Go stones) onto each of the two spaces of his color.  Then they alternately place their tokens into vacant spaces, trying to form a connected path between their original perimeter spaces.

Name: Moxie
Description:
According to the given rules, the pieces, eight on each army, start in reserve off the board.  A move consists of either:  1) placing a piece from your reserve on any vacant square; 2) moving a piece to any adjacent square, orthogonally or diagonally (as a chess king), or 3) capturing an enemy piece by jumping it, like an 8-directional checker.  Multiple jumps are allowed.  When a jump is possible, jumping is compulsory, though the player may choose any jumping move available and need not capture the greatest possible number of pieces.

The object is either to form a line of three of your pieces, orthogonally or diagonally with no intervening spaces, or to capture six enemy pieces (i.e. reduce your enemy’s forces to two so that he cannot win).

Name: Mitzvah Match
Description: Match the Mitzvah cards and win! No reading required. For 1-4 players ages 4-10.

Name: Aleph Bet Adventure
Description:
From the Publisher:

Get ready for an exciting adventure! You are going to be whisked off to an animal safari park filled with all your favorite animals and characters. Starting with the first Hebrew letter Aleph and all the way to the last letter Tov, you'll find a friendly group who is ready to help you learn the Hebrew alphabet. This fun and colorful board game provides early exposure to the Hebrew alphabet, and builds important beginning reading skills such as letter recognition, initial sounds, and more. No reading required. Perfect for school or home! For 2-4 players ages 3 and up.

Name: What's Your AstroStyle?
Description:
From the publisher:

Find your star power with What's Your AstroStyle? -, the game that reveals more than just your sign! AstroStyle is a brand created by the AstroTwins, Tali and Ophi, who are the official astrologers for Teen People Magazine. The Twins also wrote the book "AstroStyle", which gives advice for love, life and looking great. The AstroAngels are here to guide you! How well do you know your friends' hopes and dreams for the future? How well do they know yours? With more than a hundred different questions and hundreds of real-life astrological answers, you'll have plenty of chances to reveal fun secrets about your friends and yourself. There's no limit to how much your star power can shine! What's Your AstroStyle? is a game for 3 to 6 players. It has maximum interactivity every turn. Even during another player's turn, each player is fully involved in the action. Contents include 1 Zodiac Board - Game Board, 120 cards based on Love, Life & Style, 6 AstroAngel Tokens, 6 AstroWheels, 6 Answer Booklets, a Rule Sheet, and Game Die.

Name: Great States Junior
Description:
From the publisher:

Based on the best selling game, Great States!, this junior version provides the same fun, hurry-up action while introducing young players to the map of the 50 states. Find the shape! Find the picture! Find the name! Kids will have a blast searching the game board to find where things are as they travel along the red, white and blue game path. Even pre-readers can play by matching the objects on the cards to the pictures on the board.

Name: Showtime Presents: The Great Cable Challenge
Description:
Showtime Presents: the great Cable Challenge. The Exciting New Game That Tests Your Skill (And Luck) As A Cable TV Operator!

OBJECTIVE:

Players take turns rolling a die and moving along the spaces on the board from "Franchise Hearing" to "Launch" then on to "Success" to win the game.

Players landing upon "Cable Break" spaces must draw a cable break card and immediately carry out it's instructions. Some of these are to be used only after "Launch". Upon landing on any of the four red spaces, a player must stop and end his or her turn. At his or her next turn, the direction that the
Player must take will be determined by the roll.

On the last red space on the board a player must stop and then, on each subsequent turn, roll the die continuously until reaching a combined total of 7 or 11. If 11 is exceeded the Player must wait until his or her next turn to try again. The first Player to reach the "Success" circle with no Cable Break Cards in his possession has met the Cable Challenge and wins the Game.

Name: Moneywise Kids
Description:
from the publisher:

Game Concept: Practice making change while players earn a $100 bill. Then learn to budget money while spending it on life’s necessities, such as housing, food, clothing, etc.

Special Features: Two simple, fast-paced games to improve valuable math skills that kids will use all their lives. Includes facsimiles of real U.S. money. Tips are featured that parents and teachers can use to connect Moneywise Kids play with the real world.

Name: Monkey in the Middle
Description:
From the publisher:

Monkey in the Middle is a fun skill and action game that lets players take chances with the roll of the dice. With a delightfully illustrated game board, players try to roll their monkey dice into the special "Banana Zone" to earn Banana Scoring Chips. But if you roll too hard one of your monkeys may fall into the middle and be gone! A unique way for little ones to practice counting and grouping and to interact with each other.

Name: Quick Pix Animals
Description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Animals -- Which group an animal belongs to (reptile, bird, crustacean, etc.)

Name: Quick Pix Geography
Description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Geography -- in what region of the world (Western Europe, South America, etc.) countries are located

Name: Quick Pix Math
Description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Math -- Commonly used addition and subtraction facts

Name: Quick Pix Multiplication
Description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Multiplication -- Commonly used multiplication facts

Name: Quick Pix Money
Description:
From the publisher

Each game features a set of problem and answer cards. Players need to be the first to match the correct answer card to the problem card that is turned over. To win, you must think quickly, match faster and capture as many card pairs as possible.

Quick Pix Money -- Recognizing and adding different coin values

Name: Sci-ology
Description:
From the publisher:

An exhilarating science game that uses memory, thinking, and strategy skills! The goal of this exciting game is to collect the most quartets (groups of four) by using memory and strategy skills. At the same time, this fast-paced game introduces players to the different fields of science while learning fun facts provided on each card (such as, "The giant clam can be 4.5 feet tall and weigh 500 pounds"). Sci-ology is a fascinating game that is a blast for the whole family and will be played over and over again for many years to come. Includes: 48 oversized (4"x6") colorful fun fact-filled cards.

Name: McWiz: The Ultimate Game of Knowledge and Trivia
Description:
From the publisher:

Mc Wiz was created for people who like to learn while having fun and for those who like to have fun while learning. Whether you enjoy serious questions, trivia, word games, proverbs or not-so-serious questions, you'll love Mc Wiz. You are a sports or history buff, you enjoy TV and the silver screen, you like to learn about science and the world, or you're crazy about word games and completing proverbs and expressions, Mc Wiz will give you hours and hours of challenge and enjoyment. You want to learn about chemistry or brush up on your English grammar, practice your Spanish or your French, review your world capitals? Do it while having fun! Mc Wiz is a "Wise Old Owl". He has 4200 questions that are suitable for teens and adults.

Name: Typhoons & Turtleships
Description: Typhoons & Turtleships. Two player card game simulating the various attempts of the Japanese and the Koreans (Chinese & Mongols too) to conquer each other across the Sea of Japan. Players alternate being the Attacker. If the Attacker wins both the Naval and Conquest phases he wins. Strategy favors the defender, but the attacker only has to win once. Players share a deck. Some cards are specific to a certain player or a certain phase. Good filler game. Educational on an offbeat historical Topic. Complete Rules and link to card set available at:  http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/TTS.html

Name: Gimel
Description:
Each player has 24 pieces; 8 horus (large cylinders, worth 6 points), 8 bastets (large triangles, worth 3 points) and 8 scarabs (small round buttons, worth 1 point).

The game starts on an empty 8x18 board and a player can either place a new piece on an empty space of the board or move an existing one on the board - depending on it's movement restrictions.

Winner is the player with the most captures, that is not the number of captures, but the total value of the captured pieces.

Name: Narro
Description:
The name of the game is derived from the German word "Narr", which means fool or clown.

The game is played on a 12x12 board. Each player has 3 red, green, blue and yellow playing pieces, but one player uses the round pieces and the other the square ones. Each field of the board shows one of these 4 colors and the pieces can move only on fields of their color.

Object of the game is to capture all opposing pieces and still having 2 or more own pieces on the board. Captures are made by jumping over opposing pieces.

Name: Jangala
Description:
Jangala is played on a very small board (5x5) with very few playing pieces (3 per player).

You start in one edge with your 3 pieces of different size and must try to reach the opposing edge first to become winner.

Sounds very easy, but that's not true! The problem is that you are only allowed to move on empty fields or on fields with pieces not smaller than yours. Additionally, only the top pieces can move... so it's clear, that bringing your fattie on the other side of the board is really challenging.

Name: Polyp
Description:
Polyp is a little like Chinese Checkers plus the expansion of polyps, who can capture enemy playing pieces (here called fishes).

Important though, that the game ends finally, when all fishes have either reached their destinations or are captured. So the winner is the one who has most of successful fishes plus captured ones.

Quite unusual are the polyps: they are 5 pieces connected together with a thin metallic chain, which enables to move only 2 fields away from each other polyp part!

Name: Kristall
Description:
In Crystal 2-6 players try to find some hidden treasures and bring them back to the 2 starting points.

A special die not only lets players move 0-3 fields, it also determines if a treasure is found and if other special features, like the arising of a crystal wall, appear.

A funny aspect are the 4 transparent "glass-witches" which are mainly used to annoy other players. Much luck after all, but nice components anyway.

Name: Casino Las Vegas
Description:
This game is played on a round-course like Monopoly. You have to draw cards for special events and you can purchase 1 of 6 casinos when landing on their space.

But this is only one part of this game. Every time a player lands of the numerous casino-game spaces, he can "enter" the casino and play poker, craps, Chicago, (mini-)Roulette and blackjack. If the casino belongs to another player, the owner of the casino plays the bank!

Interesting, that the casino card games are played with a 32 skat deck...

Name: LOST The Card Game
Description:
This is a fast paced 'print and play' card game based around the hit ABC TV show LOST. You will attempt to play crucial event cards whilst avoiding the 'Others', wild boars and Polar Bears...

To get this game for free, go to the address below;

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

SPOILER WARNING: This game contains information and pictures from LOST episodes which may not have been screened in some countries; enter at your own risk.

LOST is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

Name: Pompiers! A Vos Lances!
Description:
The building is on fire! Don't waste any time. Send your team of firefighters to the rescue! Cover the highest number of windows, balconies and doors in order to save the maximum number of people, animals and objects.
A game for ages 6 and up.

L'immeuble est en flamme ! Ne perdez pas de temps. Préparez votre équipe de pompiers pour entreprendre le sauvetage. Accédez au plus grand nombre de fenêtres, balcons et portes pour sauver de l'incendie le maximum de personnes, d'animaux et d'objets.
Pour les 6 ans et plus.

Name: Wiggle & Giggle
Description:
Wiggle & Giggle is the ball balancing physical game of fun, a challenging game of physical movement and balance.

Players try to earn the most points by balancing the foam balls and performing the tasks shown on the spinner. For example: Hold a ball between your knees - jump 3 times. While still holding this ball, balance another ball on your shoulder (you can use your chin to hold it in place). Now, bend over, place your hands on the ground and leap like a frog! Once a challenge has been successfully completed, a point card is earned, and it's the next player's turn to try a hilarious task.

For ages 4 and up.

Name: Nuclear War Booster Packs
Description:
This 47-card expansion for Nuclear War is packaged in 8-card booster packs (inspired by the success Magic: The Gathering).

The cards appear different numbers of times on the press sheet, giving different levels of "rarity", and the boosters are more or less random. They are packed in clear plastic, with a cover/proof of purchase card (40 of the proof of purchase cards can be sent in for a free Supergerm T-shirt).

The new cards are mostly Secrets (20) and Specials (19), with three new sizes of Propaganda, four new sizes of Warhead, and one new Delivery System.

To incorporate this expansion into an existing Nuclear War/Escalation/Proliferation deck while preserving the existing balance of card types and strengths requires using a bunch of the new Propaganda and Warhead cards; to preserve the proportion of delivery systems, you either have to use a lot of the Delta Clipper or scavenge some extra "regular" delivery systems (perhaps a use for the ads/jokers from Nuclear War, or some of the blanks available from Flying Buffalo).

Name: Leap
Description: Rules are provided for five jumping and number games, four categories of jumping and number puzzles to play on the 6x6 grid. Activities with chess knights' moves and magic squares are especially interesting. A major section is devoted to Wade Philpott's "Leap Solitaire," cited in Oxford University Press' The Ins and Outs of Peg Solitaire. The 36 numbered pieces reverse to blank checkers.

Name: Dezign-8
Description: This concept was created 40 years ago by an architect, Bill Briggs. The original tile patterns are expanded from four to the full eight. Every combination of 1, 2, 3 and 4 paths exiting from a square, with enough multiples in a strategic mix, allows the creation of the most intricate designs. All you have to do is match the paths. A strange fact — no matter how you connect the paths, the number of separate groups will always equal the number of closed loops formed. The laser-cut, hand-inlaid acrylic tiles are framed so the 14" set can be displayed on its easel as an ever-changing work of art.

Name: Boats
Description: This game set was designed and developed entirely by trans-Atlantic email between Mike Roberts and Kate Jones. The ideas and messages grew and flew feverishly for months, and at last stopped at 101 beautiful and challenging figures formed by matching the boat-shaped tiles by color. The 36 tiles comprise all the ways 6 colors can be paired. Here's a sample tile.  The 13 islands in the 11" tray are fixed in place. Outside the tray 100 other exquisite lattices await. Several competitive games are included.

Name: Poly-5
Description: Nominated for the Games 100, All the shapes of 1 through 5 squares in size (polyominoes orders 1 through 5) fill a 6" tray. The multi-colored laser cut acrylic pieces serve for six games and hundreds of other puzzle shapes, as shown in the included 52-page handbook.

Name: Sextillions
Description: 36 acrylic pieces include all the shapes of 6 squares joined ("hexominoes"). Each piece has a name. They are sized to be compatible with Poly-5, making it combinable with that set. The 8½" tray and vinyl game mat accommodate four strategic games and hundreds of puzzles. A Games 100 nominee.

Name: Cube Brick
Description: On Games 100 list for 2003. Fifteen unique color-patterned cubes:  drawing on 6 colors, each cube has a unique combination of 4 colors on its 2x2 faces. Each cube face has a different arrangement of its four colors. So there are 90 all-different faces. A wealth of figures to solve by matching the cube edges, plus super challenges of 3-D shapes with non-matched solutions. Games for beginners and experts are included.

Name: Post-Time: A Horse Racing Game of Chance
Description: A game of horse racing where players are attempting to amass the greatest amount of money.

Name: Horsemen
Description: Game about harness racing where players are trying to amass money by purchasing and then racing horses.

Name: Las Vegas
Description:
This game is like Roulette with dice. Each turn, 3 dice of different colors are thrown and before that, 2-3 players can bet on the outcome of this dice throw.

The board is showing all possible bets for all 3 dice colors, from Even, Uneven, Lower, Higher and so on. 
Each player starts with 20 chips of a chosen color and he must try to be the first who wins all 108 chips of that color.

Name: Hexago
Description:
Hexago from Hexagames is played on a purple hex gameboard with about 300 hex spaces.

It's kind of Go-Moku, but you must get 6 stones in a row here. The colors of the pieces are green, orange and purple, which it not the best choice, since the purple stones on the purple board are much harder to see than the others.

Name: Sag nix über Pulok
Description:
2-4 players get a score board where the game title "Sag nix über Pulok" (=don't tell anything about Pulok) is written 6 times. This sentence contents of 15 different letters, which is important for the game.

Each player gets 15 out of 195 letter-tiles at the beginning and he has the possibility to exchange 1 of them every turn. Object of the game is to place 15 letters on the score board, which must be done with certain rules. The first player reaching this is given an extra bonus, but the winner will be determined by counting the points for the laid out tiles of each player.

The game comes with 15 funny jokers and 4 large cardboard screens (to hide the letter-tiles behind) with amusing motifs.

Name: Die Gentlemen bitten zur Kasse
Description:
"Die Gentlemen bitten zur Kasse" (The Great British Train Robbery) is a game about the famous English train robbery in 1963.

Each player must pick up mailbags at certain places of the board and bring them to 3 hideouts on the board. There are several obstacles to fulfill this: Scotland Yard can confiscate the bags for example and a player must pay kind of bribe while carrying a postbag. Earning money can be done with buying farms and these farms can also protect a player while staying there.

The game ends, when all mailbags are taken off the train. The player, who could bring the most mailbags to the hideouts is the winner.

Name: Home Stretch Harness Racing Game
Description: Victory in Harness Racing is determined mainly by skill and strategy . YOU are the driver, maneuvering for position. YOU control your horse and sulky, blocking other player's horses. As the field sweeps around the final turn into the homestretch, YOU go all out in a pulse-pounding rush for the finish line.

Name: Minoru
Description:
Minoru is a British horse racing game manufactured by John Jacques. The five horses are die cast metal painted in different colors to designate racing teams. The large playing surface is folded felt.

Named for King Edward VII's Epsom Derby-winning Irish thoroughbred racehorse, Minoru, the game Minoru was a popular parlor game, kept available in the lounge of hotels and clubs as well as in homes between the world wars.

Name: Hot Rod: The Sport Car Race
Description: A very simple race game played on a roll out mat.  While the playing pieces are nice, the most impressive piece of equipment is the massive upright, roulette wheel style spinner.

Name: Hold Your Horses
Description: Any number of people can play this simple racing game that uses a deck of cards to determine movement of five horses.

Name: Zoo
Description: Zoo: Card Game. Cards represent various animals with up to 12 traits. Players play melds of cards with the same trait. Players score victory points for having the highest score in a trait. Good Kids Game. Complete rules plus link to card set at:   http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Zoo.html

Name: Giant Wheel Thrills 'n' Spills Horse Race Game
Description: A steeplechase game played on a roll out map.  The centerpiece of the game is the giant, roulette wheel style, upright spinner that is used to determine movement.

Name: Granat
Description:
Granat (=garnet) is played on a 9 x 7.5 grid board and both players have an army of 14 pieces and 2 "Granat"-balls. Each wooden playing piece has a crater-shaped top, which enables to hold one of the metallic granat balls.

Object of the game is to capture all opposing pieces. Normal pieces can move 1 grid, but pieces holding a granat ball can move as far as they want. The granat ball can easily be displaced in your half of the board, but on the opposing half, you can only move it to an adjacent piece.

Name: Horse Wise
Description: Players answer horsemanship questions as they move their horses around the show ring, first to the right, then to the left.  Players use their knowledge of horsemanship topics to advance to the finish square and win ribbons.

Name: Neck and Neck
Description:
This a modern reproduction of a vintage game.

Players line up their horses on a three foot track and crank a handle that vibrates the board.  This in turn causes the horses to move down the track.  There are slits in the track that act as obstacles to possibly slow down the horses.  The first horse across the finish line is the winner.

Name: Show Jumping Trials
Description:
Show Jumping Trials is a unique board game where players try to complete the course over the fences, jumps, and water jump, against the timer using an 8 sided die and a 6 sided die.  When they have mastered that, they then try to complete the course while picking up the fewest faults.

The basic gameboard is a 12x12 grid.

Name: Sheep-dog Trials
Description: Sheep-dog Trials is a compact and unique little boardgame (using a 12x12 grid playing area) where players are competing with each other and a timer.  Each player attempts to round up as many sheep as possible against the clock - whilst the sheep attempt to keep out of the dog's reach. The sheep can jump the fences but the dog must go through the gate!  Then the roles are reversed!

Name: Yachting
Description: YACHTING is colorful, easy to understand and easy to play, suitable for players aged 5 and up, where players players pick a Yacht and using only a wind direction dice, they must attempt to navigate out of the harbor and round the course, from buoys 1 to 6, and back to the harbor.

Name: Fairies and Rainbows
Description: Fairies and Rainbows is a simple but enjoyable game for anyone who loves fairies. Try to collect the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow, but watch out for the goblins!

Name: Teddy Bear and Friends
Description: Teddy Bear and Friends, 100 years after the creation of the first Teddy Bear comes a new game from Shannon Boardgames that celebrates their favorite pastime, picnics! The object of the game is to try and collect the perfect picnic. Beware though as you must always keep your eye on your hamper as other Players attempt to steal your collection. "Teddy Bear and Friends" is a game that will delight both children and adults alike.

Name: Dribble
Description:
Dribble is intended for people aged 5 years old and upwards, and is fun and easy to play. Played with 2 dice and a timer for half time and full time, two players compete against each other to score as many goals as possible.

Throw-ins, Corner Kicks, are all possible and the games quick format lends itself to tournament playing amongst friends.

There are also customized editions for Celtic, Rangers, Aberdeen and Clydebank Football Clubs. The Celtic and Rangers versions are twice the size of the regular edition.

Name: I-Spy
Description:
I Spy! is a unique travel board game that can be enjoyed by anyone to while away the journey.  The game is fun and easy to play. Players have to remain focused on the game and their surroundings to win. The unique game format ensures that your surroundings and your concentration (and a bit of luck!) will decide the winner.

If you want a bit of peace and quiet on your journey -- stay at home. But if you want to make the journey more bearable, then this is the game for you!

Name: Howzat!
Description: "Howzat!" is a must have board game for all lovers of the sport of cricket! Roll the dice and make your shot.  Try to out-do your opponent in this game of wits and strategy. Will you make a century or be out for a duck?  If it's not "Howzat!" then it just isn't cricket!

Name: Planetarium
Description: "Planetarium" is a beautifully illustrated game based on the night sky, where players have to move around the board trying to connect a string of colored constellations before their opponents do.

Name: Clans and Tartans of Scotland
Description: In each pack are sixty cards forming ten stunning images of Scottish Highlanders in full regalia with the Clan Tartan, Clan Crest and each Highlander complete with a brief history of their Clan. This gift can be played as a game (and it's quite a challenge!) or simply be pieced together for your visual enjoyment.

Name: Property Tycoon
Description: In Property Tycoon, players move around the board and buy property using a hidden bid system. Players do not know who they are bidding against — if anyone — as only one player has to reveal intent. You can be financially ruined and out of the game before you even start on the property ladder.

Name: Crazy Circles
Description: Crazy Circles is a colorful game for 5 year olds and upwards. It is very easy to play but very frustrating. You simply have to get from the start to the finish -- easy?  There is no skill required for this game -- just a lot of luck and a desire to have some fun.

Name: Burns and Verse
Description: Burns and Verse comprises 10 beautiful images of the great poet Robert Burns and/or associates complemented with a wonderful verse.  Burns and Verse can be enjoyed as a game amongst friends, or pieced together by lovers of Burns poetry.

Name: Alley Cat
Description: Alley Cat is a game for cat lovers of all ages. Take on the role of a domestic house cat and try to collect the various items that have been scattered over the rooms of the house.  Beware of the dog!

Name: Vampire Requiem
Description: Battle it out with Vampires, beasts, demons and even humans to try and establish dominance over your foes in this unique and superbly illustrated card game.

Name: Morgan Junior: The Race Is On
Description: Based loosely on Shannon Boardgames previous game of paying attention while traveling -- I-Spy.  Players are trying to be the first to make it past the finish line.

Name: Nessie: An Aquatic Adventure
Description: Nessie - An Aquatic Adventure was designed for the Loch Ness 2000 exhibition based on the shores of Loch Ness near Urquhart Castle.

Name: Scamp
Description: "Scamp" is a game about Guide Dogs created specially for the "Guide Dogs for the Blind" association. The object is to make it from your home to the park whilst keeping your guide dog by your side.

Name: Falkirk Wheel
Description: "The Falkirk Wheel" is a game commissioned by "British Waterways Scotland" to be sold in the gift shop housed in the Falkirk Wheel complex, which was opened in 2002.  This is a simple game mimicking the wheel's rotational movement.

Name: Bottoms Up
Description:
From Box 
"A classic game played on a checker board and combining some of the choice aspects of chess, droughts, poker and bridge. yet so easy to learn everyone achieves competence sufficient for enjoyment during the first game. Accommodates 2,3 or 4 players
at once."

The object of the game is to accumulate the highest score, which is not necessarily the same as capturing all of one's opponent's pieces.

Moves: Any counter or piece may be moved exactly like a chess queen however limited to the number of squares moved at a single turn by the number on its bottom. that is a counter may be moved perpendicular to the sides of the squares or along the diagonals provided there is no obstruction but limited by the number on the bottom. 
General Rule: Any piece moved more than one square on a single turn of a player must be turned and played bottom up for the remainder of the game .... capture is the same as in chess .... a players score is the sum of the numbers on the bottoms of the opposing pieces he/she has captured plus the sum of the numbers on his/her own counters remaining on the board at end.
etc etc

Name: Pago Pago
Description:
"There's never been anything like this crossword puzzle game!"  That seems likely...

The game consists of three large sheets of paper, with each four different crossword puzzles on each side of each sheet.  Two to four (as two teams) players work the puzzle on their side of the square sheet for three minutes, each with their own colored pencil.  When time is up, the sheet is rotated 90 degrees, the timer is reset, and the players work the new (to them) puzzle now on their side.
  
You keep adding letters and/or correcting mistakes, then rotating every three minutes until the puzzles are completed or everyone gives up.  You get points for correct letters you've added, and you subtract points for errors noted by your opponents.  The colored pencils allow end-of-game scoring and adjudication of the puzzles.  Answers are provided in sealed envelopes.

Seems like it would be fun, but you'd really have to love crosswords - working them with time pressure is sweet misery.  Six games can be played by four players with the supplied puzzles.  Refill puzzles were available in 1985 using the handy order form, but good luck now.

Name: Flip-It Twenty One
Description:
Featuring Flip Wilson on the cover, the object of this game is to be the first to reach 21 without going over (ala Blackjack).
Played like regular Blackjack, each player receives one hand card and shoots for their other cards using the spring-loaded ball to hit a blue plastic ball around the roulette-like board. Once a card has been rolled the player marks it with one of the small embossed plastic markers.

Name: Flip-It 7-11
Description:
A dice game that features a disc shooting mechanism to generate dice rolls. The game board also supports play as a standard craps table.
The game features Flip Wilson on the cover.

Name: The Historic Mackinac Island Game
Description: Players roll dice and move around the board gaining colors by marking their score sheets with the color of the space they land on (each depicting the name of a Mackinac Island merchant.) When a player collects 7 of any color, he moves to one of two dock spaces. From there, players attempt to roll specific combinations in order to advance to the island and collect a Historic card, and then return back to start. Historic cards are worth 75-150 points. First one to 500 points wins.

Name: East Front
Description:
East Front is a simulation on a Corps/Army level of the Russo-German war of 1941-1945. The game covers the entire war from the Axis invasion of Russia to the final destruction of the Axis armies four years later.  In addition to the campaign game, there are scenarios covering the invasion of Poland, yearly scenarios for Operation Barbarossa, Stalingrad, Kursk and the Destruction of Army Group Center and a smaller, German High Water scenario cover the period from November 1942 - Jan 1943.  The game is unique in that it uses hexagonal shaped counters instead of the standard square counters.

800 counters (2 sets of 2 counter sheets)
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Burgermeister!
Description: Be the "Top Bun" with this fast paced card game!  Build a burger with cards and add the right sides.

Name: Serenity: The Unofficial Board Game
Description:
From the creator of the game:

"I made up a game based on Firefly and Serenity, in which you fly around the 'verse looking for work and trying to put together a crew."

"You try not to get pirated by other players, avoid the Reavers and Alliance, and try to earn credits. "

There is a preview here: http://www.fireflyfans.net/sunroomitem.asp?i=10704

Game can be downloaded here:  http://docs.google.com/leaf?id=0Bz_OJBPpg5bKNWMyOTMyMzktMmNmZi00NDNmLTg4N2YtYzgzNGE1OGQyODk1&hl=en

Home Page: http://www.coroflot.com/micjwelch

Name: Forino
Description:
Something is happening in the cheese! The mice are very hungry and are very keen on tasty cheese. Through the holes at the sides and in the top of the cheese the children try to catch themselves the pieces of cheese that are stuck to the magnets.

But beware - those who get caught by a cat lose a turn!

(For Ages 3+)

Name: Seebär, ahoi
Description:
Four sailing ships are docked in the port. The little sea dogs have to skillfully use their colored sails in order to be the first to reach the mysterious rainbow island. One by one, in a clockwise direction, the players each pull a sail out of the sailor's kit bag: the boat onto which a colored sail is stuck moves ahead to the next free square of the same color as the sail. As there can only be one sail of each color on the masts of the boats, the sails sometimes have to be stuck on the boats of others players. Watch out: If a black sail is stuck on a boat, it has to move backwards. The sea dog who brings their boat into the bay of the rainbow island first wins the game.

Ages 4 and up.

Name: Cross'n GO
Description:
from the publisher

This game is built on a mobile checker board, which you composed differently at the beginning of each game. The player can only move forward on the road of his color; he has to move the bars of the checker board to proceed by following the points to move the bars. Your stake will be always TO CHOOSE between building your road or putting barriers on the road of your opponent, or even, destroy this road… Your behaviors will have to be well-balanced: “too nice” and you will be blinded and immobilized, “too nasty” and you will have to face the unforeseen obstacles raised by your opponent and also by yourself.

Name: Armored Attack: 1939 to 1990
Description:
A set of miniatures rules for Tanks skirmish level historical wargaming (1 stand = 1 tank, 1 stand = squad/ldr/weapon team)

Movement is simultaneous.

Fire Order is determined by assigning units to cards and shuffling the deck and turning over the card.
 Fire order is then enhanced by an initiative roll.  
Contains lots of ratings for weapons/vehicles from WW2 through the mid-80's

Name: The Game of Wisdom
Description:
The basis of the game is to convince a JUDGE and collect LAURELS. You roll the die, move one of your tokens and draw a card corresponding to the color you landed on. The JUDGE gives 15 seconds (timer not included) for anyone else who would like THE RIGHT TO SPEAK to indicate they would like to answer. After the time has elapsed the JUDGE rereads the question back to the original player, the payer has 30 seconds to answer and reason (Yes/No is not sufficient). There is CRITERIA to determine if the answer is acceptable. The JUDGE, regardless of if the answer is to their taste, awards a LAUREL to any answer that meets criteria. A player may CHALLENGE a ruling and risk losing two LAURELS. Anyone else who has asked for THE RIGHT TO SPEAK may provide their answer. If they REPEAT what the first answer was, they lose a LAUREL. If they also provide a satisfactory answer, they receive a LAUREL. After a player has answered one of each coloured card and has 12 LAURELS they may predict even or odd on their turn and finish PHASE 1

For PHASE 2

As the player CLIMBS THE LADDER OF WISDOM in phase two, they must always contribute an answer on another players turn by using the RIGHT TO SPEAK TOKEN. As well, on their turn they must Guess EVEN/ODD before rolling. Being unable to answer or failing to contribute costs five LAURELS or go down a rung. Once at the top there is a final guess of EVEN / ODD to be declared THE GREAT THINKER.

Name: Where in Time Is Carmen Sandiego
Description:
Description from the box:

THE MYSTERY HISTORY GAME

Carmen is hiding somewhere in time - your mission is to check each century on the game board until you find her.

Along the way, you'll race to put historical events in their correct order. Then, match stolen loot to its correct century. Is Paul Revere's horse from the 18th century or the 17th? Did it appear before or after Pocahontas saved Captain John Smith? You'll find out as you track Carmen in this exciting game that brings history to life.

Name: Wild Rush
Description: A Japanese game from the makers of R-Eco. Wild Rush is aptly named, as players fling cards into a center receptacle which is cleverly put together from a folded-up design. The first player to get rid of their cards wins, but there are rules about which cards can be tossed and when.

Name: Wir Gehören zusammen!
Description: A fun children's game about how to properly deal with dogs. The game includes a set of colorful cards depicting situations that a child could encounter with dogs, such as two dogs fighting, etc. The player must then play a card which shows the proper response to the action. There are cards that show both right and wrong reactions.

Name: Sandwiching Game
Description: The full name of this game is the "Addition, Multiplication, Calculation Sandwiching Game". The board is two sided and each side shows a 9 x 9 grid. One side is for addition and the other for multiplication. Players place pieces on the grid and try to roll combinations that will remove other players' pegs. A Japan Brain Sports Association winner.

Name: Zoned
Description: A wooden game with a very limited print run. The pieces in the game are a single square attached to a triangle with a base twice the size of the square side (like a house with a full roof but only one half below). Similar to 1 Stein + Co, pieces are placed on a grid with the goal of blocking off territory. Cubes are placed in the closed in spaces and the player who can place most of their cubes wins.

Name: Trio Trio
Description: A wooden abstract where players use multi-colored stones and try to create sets of three through clever movement.

Name: Lincoln's War
Description:
Lincoln's War uses the same grid based system as the "Square Bashing" World War One rules, where the play surface is subdivided into 1 foot (30 cm) squares.  Units advance from square to square coming into conflict when they wish to advance into one of the opponent's square.

The game is designed for a 6' x 4' table.  Terrain is abstracted; the individual squares are rated as open (little or no terrain) and closed (terrain that encumbers movement such as woods or towns).  Because figures are simply moved from one large square to another, basing standards are very relaxed; units can be based in almost any fashion and both sides need not be identical.

The game system includes rules for off-table effects such as cavalry scouting, supply and shortening/lengthening the scenario.

The scale is as follows:

Infantry regiments are 3-5 bases.
Artillery batteries are 1 base.
Cavalry regiments are 3-4 bases.

Individual squares can hold up to 10 units of infantry or cavalry or 5 units of artillery.
Families: Series: Rule For The Common Man (Peter Pig)

Name: Car Wars Supplement, The AADA Vehicle Guide: Volume 3
Description:
From the back cover:

Here they are... the AADA's choice for the meanest vehicle designs of the year.  From Division 5 to Division 100+, they're fully armed, completely described and ready to go.
This book brings you 78 brand-new designs, all compatible with the Car Wars Compendium rules and legal for AADA World Championship competition.  From cycles to campers, from the tough little Fire Imp to the monstrous Polaris, every one is a highway warrior's dream.

And every one of these 78 new vehicles is represented by four counters, included with this book... a full color vehicle, a full color wreck, and black-and-white versions of both the new and wrecked car, to let you fly your own colors in the arena.
So fasten your seat belt, check out all vehicle systems, and hit the road for more Car Wars action.  And never forget... no matter where you go... drive offensively!

Part of the Car Wars Series.

Expands:

    Car Wars
    Car Wars Compendium

Name: Hindu Windu
Description: Hindu Windu is a beer and pretzels game about fakirs racing on their carpets.  You can win the game in 2 ways - by getting to the goal line first, or by being the last one left alive. To stop his opponents each fakir can either fight, or use magic spells.

Name: Rhino!
Description: A game with beautiful wooden Rhinos that uses the same ideas as Wittigs' Mary Pennylane and Raina. Players try to pull the Rhinos toward a goal using a die that determines which rope can be held.  The Rhino is pulled until caught.

Name: Ozette
Description:
The game represents whale hunting in the village of Ozette (a prehistoric settlement on the American West Coast which was buried in a mudslide around 1500 A.D. and excavated in the 20th century).

The game mat depicts a whale. Prey stones are placed on the ribs. Players spin an unusual spintop, resulting in 1-3 red and 1-3 blue arrows pointing up. Depending on the number of red arrows, players move their playing pieces from rib to rib and collect prey stones, but only if the hunting stone is showing the whale. The hunting stone can be flipped instead of moving. When all prey has been collected, the player with most prey wins. However, if three blue arrows show six times during the game, the whale wins and the player loses. Depending on which arrow they spin the spintop with, players can influence the outcome of their spin.
